taskDescription: How could you distinguish between the isomers cyclopentanecarboxylic acid and 4-hydroxycyclohexanone by 1H and 13C NMR spectroscopy? (See Problem 20-15.)
detailedSolution: 4-Hydroxycyclohexanone: H–C–O absorption near 4 δ in the 1H spectrum and C═O absorption near 210 δ in the 13C spectrum. Cyclopentanecarboxylic acid: –CO2H absorption near 12 δ in the 1H spectrum and  –CO2H absorption near 170 δ in the 13C spectrum.
